intro: Erigeron potosinus, commonly known as the Potosi fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron potosinus is often found in open grasslands and along rocky slopes, where it thrives in full sun.
